caption: erratasec.blogspot.com

data.message:
Really cool article showing a side of things that won't come through in mainstream media.

I have the same sentiments as the author that this is an amazing effort by people who want to do something. I think it's great that they're out there and getting heard. What they're saying makes me cringe though.

I also think he's right about it getting co-opted which makes me sad. Same as the tea party it is a group of people fed up enough to so something, but without a clear definition of what that something is it's just waiting for someone to fill in the blanks and take it over.

Very cool stuff going on though.

Nice article.  Much of what OWS says makes me cringe too, but there are things that I wholeheartedly support and agree with and I hope those things end up shaking out in all of this and actually pursued to a conclusion (or at least get on the right path) that benefits us.

description: I was unhappy with the poor journalistic coverage of the Occupy Wall Street protests, so I went to Wall Street myself to see what’s going on, and report on it. It’s the quality of the coverage, not the amount that's the problem. It’s been on the nightly news every night for the past week, but there ...
message: Must read: fascinating observations directly from OWS (from a Libertarian).
name: Errata Security: Independent reporting of #OccupyWallStreet
